dialogues.text: Yes, I did.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: I didn't.  And you being the one at the end of the aisle didn't just fix that. Ike takes this in.  She's reaching him -- but then the de go back up.  He turns to her.

dialogues.speaker: IKE
dialogues.text: No, I couldn't fix anything... (as he gets up) But I still ended up chasing a truck. Ike moves out to the balcony.  After a moment, Maggie fol

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The balcony overlooks Central Park.  The twinkling lights city stretch out across the beautiful night.  Ike looks o the view with his back to Maggie as she speaks.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: I understand why you bring up the truck. Let me explain something.  The fact is, you've seen me at my worst, most embarrassing, deviously plotting, potentially but not certifiably, psychotic state.  And if you liked me then, I mean, now... I can't imagine... (crosses to him) Benedict. Ike has no response. MAGGIE (cont'd) I love eggs Benedict.  I hate all the other kinds. She hesitates. MAGGIE (cont'd) ... I hate big weddings with everybody staring.  I would like to get married on a weekday while everybody is at work. If I ride off into the sunset, I want my own horse.

dialogues.speaker: IKE
dialogues.text: Should I be writing this down? She returns to the balcony and hands him the box. IKE (cont'd) What's this?

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: These are for you. He opens it.  It's her running shoes.

dialogues.speaker: IKE
dialogues.text: Used?

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: They're mine.  I'm turning in my running shoes to you.

dialogues.speaker: IKE
dialogues.text: This is getting serious. Now she is glowing at him, shining with the full force of

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: And one more thing.  I know it's hard to believe there could be more.  Um... Maggie glances around and spots a DECK CHAIR, which she t it is facing the city lights.  Then she softly says: MAGGIE (cont'd) If you could have a seat, please. Ike sits.  Maggie takes the box from him and puts it aide then she gets down on one knee.

dialogues.speaker: IKE
dialogues.text: (laughing) Oh my God.  No. Maggie smiles up at him.  Ike tips his head back and cove eyes with his hand.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: No, no -- don't hide your face, this only happens once in a lifetime.  It's definitely a first to me, and you're not going to want to miss it. He smiles as he looks at Maggie. MAGGIE (cont'd) I love you, Homer Eisenhower Graham. Will you marry me? Ike swallows, overwhelmed, overjoyed, and scared shitless

dialogues.speaker: IKE
dialogues.text: Maggie, I gotta think about this a little bit. Maggie hops cheerfully back to her feet.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: (cheerful) Good. She gets off her knees and stands. MAGGIE (cont'd) I was hoping you'd say that.

dialogues.speaker: IKE
dialogues.text: (laughing) You were not.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: I was, because if you said "yes" right away, I wouldn't get to say this next part.  And I've been practicing it. (pulling up a chair and sitting) Ready?

dialogues.speaker: IKE
dialogues.text: I'm listening.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: (tenderly) "I guarantee that we'll have tough times.  I guarantee  that at some point one or both oof us will want to get out. But I also guarantee that if I don't ask you to be mine, I'll regret it for the rest of my life. Because I know in my heart -- you're the only one for me". Ike takes her hands affectionately.

dialogues.speaker: IKE
dialogues.text: Pretty good speech, Maggie.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: I borrowed it from this guy I know. So? Ike looks into Maggie's shining face and pauses.  He gets motions with his hand for her to stay seated.  He goes in turns on some music.  The cat is sitting by the radio.  H returns to the balcony and takes Maggie's hand.

dialogues.speaker: IKE
dialogues.text: Dance with me. They start to dance a slow dance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see a hill and on top of it is a Pastor marrying Maggi Ike, in beautiful wedding attire.  We see Maggie walk dow leaf-lined aisle to a waiting Ike.  They kiss as we hear and hear them each say "I do".  They kiss a twirling, whi kiss, a circular kiss.  We hear the applause of about twe people.  Slowly, we see the twenty people come over the c the hill.  They are all Maggie's family and friends, plus old grooms.  They are all paired in twos, like a love Noa We see others get the news.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Priest Brian hears about Maggie's wedding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Trout hears about Maggie's wedding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George, Groom #3, hears about Maggie's wedding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellie and Fisher hear about Maggie's wedding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maggie and Ike finally break the kiss.  Ike takes her han walks her to two horses.  Ike and Maggie, on the two hors off happily in their wedding clothes.  As the group cheer Maggie throws bouquet.  We see it float in the air. FADE TO BLACK.
